intro: Gnidia verdickii, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its dense wood, it is valued for its strength and durability in traditional and local uses.
